Animal Crossing.passage: Animal Crossing: Happy Home Designer is a life simulation video game developed by Nintendo and Koei Tecmo and published by Nintendo for the Nintendo 3DS. It was released in Japan on November 18, 2017, and worldwide in March 20, 2018. The gameplay is similar to previous Animal Crossing games. The game follows Tom Nook as he tries to sell homes to the player's villagers. The player can customize the interior of the homes, which affects the happiness and prosperity of the villagers. The villagers also have their own personal lives, and the player can affect these lives by doing favors for them. Happy Home Designer features new features such as a building editor, which allows the player to create and share their own designs for homes. The player can also use the game's camera to take photographs of their village and use them as wallpapers on their homes. The game also features online functionality, which allows users to share designs for homes and play with other users' villages. Animal Crossing: Happy Home Designer received positive reviews from critics, who praised the game's visuals, sound, and customization options. However, some critics criticized its short length. The game was a commercial success, selling over 1.5 million copies worldwide within three months of its release. It received a Nintendo Switch port in June 2022, titled Animal Crossing: New Horizons.

qae_pairs.explanation: Tom Nook is the main character of the game.

qae_pairs.explanation: Animal Crossing: Happy Home Designer was released in Japan on November 18, 2017, and worldwide in March 20, 2018. Animal Crossing: New Horizons was released in June 2022.

Batman.passage: Batman: The Enemy Within is a five-issue American comic book limited series, featuring the DC Comics characters Batman and Robin. Written by Paul Dini and Alex Ross, with art by Dustin Nguyen, the series is notable for its dark and mature tone, and for its exploration of Bruce Wayne's descent into madness. Crysis.passage: Crysis is a 2007 first-person shooter video game developed by Crytek and published by Electronic Arts. It was released for Microsoft Windows and Xbox 360 in November 2007, and for PlayStation 3 in February 2008. The game is set on a fictionalized New York City called "Urban Warfare", in which humans are fighting an extraterrestrial race of alien beings known as the Ceph, who have invaded Earth. The player controls "Prophet", a "Nanosuit"-wearing soldier who is trying to stop the alien invasion. The Nanosuit is a powered exoskeleton that can enhance the player's speed, strength, and armor, and can be upgraded with "Nanotrites" to increase its abilities. The game features a sandbox-like leveling system, where players can use resources found throughout the game to unlock new abilities and purchase items. Crysis received critical acclaim upon release, with praise directed at its visuals and gameplay, but received some criticism for its length and technical issues. The game sold over 2. 7 million copies by March 2011, becoming one of the best-selling first-person shooters. A sequel, Crysis 2, was released in 2011, followed by a prequel, Crysis 3, in 2013. A remastered version of the original game was released for Microsoft Windows and PlayStation 4 in October 2017, and for Xbox One in June 2018.

qae_pairs.question: What month did Crysis come out on PlayStation 3?
qae_pairs.explanation: Crysis was released for PlayStation 3 in February 2008.

qae_pairs.explanation: Crytek is a German video game developer based in Frankfurt, Germany. It was founded in 1999 by Faruk Yerli and Avni Yerli, and is best known for developing the Crysis series.

Dead Rising.passage: Dead Rising is an American action-horror-survival-adventure video game series published by Microsoft Studios. It is primarily developed by Blue Castle Games. The series began in 2006 with Dead Rising, and has continued with Dead Rising 2 (2008), Dead Rising 2: Off the Record (2011), Dead Rising 2: Case West (2013), Dead Rising 3 (2012), and a cancelled game, Dead Rising 4 (2015). The games take place within a fictionalized version of the fictional Californian town of Willamette, which is overrun by zombies during an outbreak. Players control one of four survivors, each with their own story and gameplay styles, and must explore and scavenge the town for weapons and resources, while fighting and evading the undead. The series has received critical acclaim and commercial success. Dead Rising and Dead Rising 2 were included in the Guinness World Records Gamer's Edition in 2009 and 2010, for being the best-selling video games that were not bundled with a console. Dead Rising 2 was also the first game to sell one million copies in the UK in a calendar year, and the first to sell two million copies in the UK in a week. Dead Rising 2 was the best-selling game in the UK for 2011, and the series as a whole was the best-selling video game franchise in the UK during 2011 and 2012.

DC Comics.passage:
DC Comics, commonly referred to as DC, is one of the largest American comic book publishers and is the flagship company of DC Comics Group. It is owned by Warner Bros. Entertainment, a subsidiary of AT&T's WarnerMedia. DC was founded in 1934 as Detective Comics, Inc., by the publisher of the newspaper Action Comics, Charles G. Murphy. It was renamed National Comics Publications in 1938, and then DC Comics in 1939, when the company's name was taken from the trademark registration DC Comics, which had been filed in 1933. The company was acquired by DC Entertainment, a subsidiary of Warner Bros.

DC's main competitor is Marvel Comics. The two companies have engaged in numerous legal disputes regarding copyrights, trademarks, and ownership of characters. DC has also been known as "DC or DC Comics" to avoid being confused with Marvel, which has also used "Marvel Comics" or "Marvel" as its name. In the 2000s, the company experienced a decline in sales, but has since experienced success due to the New 52 relaunch, the Rebirth initiative, the DC You initiative and the DC Super Hero Girls franchise. In 2010, DC was the third largest publisher in terms of market share, and the fourth largest in terms of value.

qae_pairs.question: What is the name of the person who founded DC Comics?
qae_pairs.explanation: Charles G. Murphy founded DC Comics.

qae_pairs.question:
1. How did the company that became DC Comics get its name?
2. Which company was it renamed?
3. Which company was founded by the publisher of what newspaper?

Europe.passage: Europe is a continent that comprises the westernmost part of Eurasia. Europe is bordered by the Arctic Ocean to the north, the Atlantic Ocean to the west, and the Mediterranean Sea to the south. To the east and southeast, Europe is generally considered as separated from Asia by the watershed divides of the Ural and the Caucasus Mountains, with the narrow Strait of Bosporus between Europe and Asia at the north end of the Mediterranean. The Russian Federation is a large European sovereign state, which comprises about 20 percent of the continent's land area; Turkey, a transcontinental country, is the largest predominantly Asian state and the second-largest country in the world, and the largest in Europe. Approximately one-eighth of Europe's population of about 740 million people, or approximately 20% of the world's population, lives in the EU, which covers about 10,180,400 square kilometres (3,906,100 sq mi), or 2% of the Earth's total surface area.

Earth.passage: Earth (from Latin "terra";[note 1] Italian: "terra"; French: "terre"; German: "Erde"; Dutch: "aarde"; Danish: "jord"; Swedish and Norwegian: "jord"; Finnish: "maa"; Russian: "zemlya"; Polish: "ziemię"; Czech: "země"; Slovak: "zem", "zeme"; Ukrainian: "земля"; Ancient Greek: "γῆ" (gé) "gē"; Latin: "globus" "glōbus") is the third planet from the Sun and the only object in the universe known to support life. It is the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System by volume and mass, while its surface area makes it the largest of the terrestrial planets. It is geologically old, about 4.5 billion years, and its slow rotation and oblateness cause it to have a nearly spherical shape. Earth's hydrosphere is the largest of any known planetary body in the Solar System; it has a greater combined mass than that of all the other planets, and contains more than 95% of Earth's known water. Earth's lithosphere is divided into several rigid tectonic plates that move about, slowly, relative to each other. These plates interact with one another at divergent boundaries and converge at convergent boundaries.

qae_pairs.question: What is the age of Earth?
qae_pairs.explanation: 4.5 billion years

Willamette.passage: The Willamette River is about 350 miles (560 km) long, draining a basin of about 70,000 square miles (180,000 km2) in the western Cascade Range of Oregon and Washington in the United States. The river's drainage basin is larger than that of the Colorado, Columbia, Mississippi, Missouri, and Rio Grande Rivers combined. The Willamette River is the third longest river in Oregon at approximately 350 miles (560 km) in length.

Microsoft Studios.passage: Microsoft Studios is a video game development subsidiary of Microsoft based in Redmond, Washington. It was founded as Microsoft Game Studios (MGS) in 1991 by the merger of SoftKey and Microsoft's internal game studios. Microsoft's first internally developed game, Minesweeper, was released as a single-player game in November 1997. It was later expanded into a multi-player game and released as part of the Microsoft Plus! pack. In the following years, MGS expanded to include several other studios. The company's first internally developed first-person shooter (FPS) game, Halo: Combat Evolved, was released in 2001, and was a critical and commercial success. The game's sequel, Halo 2, was released in 2004 to critical acclaim. The success of Halo 2 led to the creation of the Halo franchise, which has since expanded to include several other games. Microsoft Studios' first open-world action-adventure game was the 2005 game Fable, followed by the 2008 game Fable II. The company's first role-playing game (RPG) game, Age of Empires II, was released in 1999. The game received critical acclaim, with critics praising the game's historical setting, depth, and customization options. Microsoft Studios' first real-time strategy game (RTS), Age of Empires Online, was released in 2007.

qae_pairs.question: How many years after the release of Halo 2 did Microsoft Studios release Fable II?
qae_pairs.explanation: Fable II was released in 2008, four years after the release of Halo 2.

qae_pairs.explanation: Microsoft Studios is a video game development subsidiary of Microsoft based in Redmond, Washington.

qae_pairs.explanation: Microsoft Studios' first real-time strategy game (RTS), Age of Empires Online, was released in 2007.
